p: The cultivation of plants to obtain bioactive compounds has led to drawbacks, such as overharvesting of plants to obtain bioactive compounds, different environmental conditions tend to produce low yields, and total synthesis and semisynthesis are challenging due to complex structures [ 65]. A number of endophytic microorganisms have produced anticancer, antimicrobial, antidiabetic, insecticidal, and immunosuppressive compounds [ 66]. Plants growing in a variety of places possibly harbor endophytes with novel natural products [ 66, 67].
